title: Smooth auto-scroll to top on evangelism page navigation

requirements.text: Implement smooth auto-scroll to the top of the page whenever the user navigates to any of these evangelism routes: /why-jesus (Why Jesus?), /how-to-begin (How to Begin), /assurance-next-steps (Assurance & Next Steps), /connect (Ready to Connect/Connect). This scroll-to-top should trigger on route entry regardless of which internal link initiated navigation (top navigation, in-page links, CTA buttons).

quotes: Consider options 1 but with a smooth auto-scroll to top and for (Why Jesus, How to Begin, Assurance & Next Steps, Ready to  Connect

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /why-jesus, /how-to-begin, /assurance-next-steps, or /connect results in a smooth scroll to window top (top=0).
The smooth scroll behavior occurs when clicking the evangelism pages' internal <Link> navigation cards and when using header navigation (where applicable).
Other routes (e.g., /feed, /submit-testimony, /peace-with-god) do not gain new forced scroll-to-top behavior as part of this change.

constraints: Do not edit frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.frontend.immutablePaths.
Keep changes limited to frontend routing/page components; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Do not implement scroll-to-top for all routes globally (only the specified evangelism pages).
Do not change evangelism page content, layout, or add new evangelism pages.
